page.title: 14Turnditch Parish Church
page.content: This stone edifice is dedicated to All Saints.It is a simple stone church with a nave and a chancel. The Vicar is the Rev.Mike Alexander who is also Vicar of Hazelwood. Services are held each Sunday.The Church magazine is the {Turnditch and Windley News }but it contains information about all sorts of other things happening in the parish.The churchwardens this year are Mr.F.Yoell and Mr.P.Waldron. There was no burial ground until 1846. More ground was consecrated in 1890.Mr. and Mrs.V.Vallance keep the church and churchyard tidy. The ecclesiastical parish covers the whole of Turnditch and Windley, there never having been a church at Windley so far as we know.Until 1846, it was a daughter chapel of Duffield Parish Church in the Hundred of Appletree.
